column4: The instruction line for the smb:// printer is a bit ambiguous.  Could somone tell me what to put in for the supposed setup of  "smb://[workgrou/]server[:port]/printer"
I'm not really sure what the brackets mean.  Optional? do I actually need them in brackets?
sorry, I think I'm asking a pretty straightforward question. Could anyone help me out on getting my windows printer to work? I just need clarification.  google is not being very informative.
Is the printer you're trying to connect to supported by Windows drivers?
Does the printer you're trying to connect to have Linux drivers available?
I do not know.  I will search and see.  I just figured I would be able to at least see it.  just a minute then.....
On linuxprinting.org, it shows my printer as working 'perfectly' with the suggested 'hpijs' driver.  Will I have to install it manually? I figured It would ask me for a driver once I found it.
Check synaptic, it might be installed already. You should be able to find a guide on how to set it up somewhere, just remember to give it the UNC address of your WIndows printer as the target
So I guess I really just need to know how to decipher the line its asking me to give.  It's a bit ambiguous in my opinion.
usually it's just smb://user:password@Workgroup/Share but you still need the normal local printing support set up and working first
Hang five, I'm checking what I use for my Brotehr laser
I'm digging for mine right now
smb:///username:password@computer/Printer f the share has a password attached
okay, new problem.  Whenever I hit the @ for the user name and password, it switches the line to "/localhost"
usser: Odd..... it said it wasn't shared on my vista pc, even though I can print on it off my vista laptop..... so I shared it, and it seems to be working a bit better now.
sounds like a permissions issue then
